name: Broccoli Cheese Squares
author: Margaret Syrotiak
summary: So incredibly good you will not believe how easy they are to make. A family secret recipe that leaves lots of room for interpretation. We eat these a lot in the summer for dinner with a salad and a loaf of good bread. YUM! But be sure that if adding cooked ingredients, allow them to cool a bit before adding milk and eggs so they don't start to scramble. Eat lukewarm for best flavor or warm.
ingredients: 2 (10 ounce) packages frozen broccoli florets, thawed and drained
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Place butter in a 9x13-inch casserole dish; place the casserole dish in the preheating oven until butter melts
Mix broccoli, Cheddar cheese, milk, flour, eggs, baking powder, salt, and black pepper in a large bowl
Pour mixture over melted butter in the casserole dish
Bake in the preheated oven until casserole is golden brown on top and cheese is melted, 30 to 45 minutes
Eat at room temperature for best flavor
